On 20 August 2006 he became the youngest player ever to play for [[FK Haugesund|Haugesund]],{{cite web|url=http://www.h-avis.no/article/20060822/SPORT/108220002 |title=Slipper Nordtveit til landslaget |publisher=Haugesund Avis |date=22 August 2006 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204171720/http://www.h-avis.no/article/20060822/SPORT/108220002 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} as he was selected for the starting line-up in a 2–0 victory against [[Sogndal Fotball|Sogndal]] at [[Haugesund stadion|Haugesund Stadium]]. He made nine league appearances during the [[Norwegian First Division 2007|following season]] for Haugesund in the [[Norwegian First Division]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nifs.no/personprofil.php?person_id=19752 |title=Nordtveit factfile – Norwegian & International Statistics of Football |publisher=Nifs.no |accessdate=15 March 2009}} That season he also appeared in the [[Norwegian Football Cup 2007|Norwegian Football Cup]], being in the starting line up in the 1–6 victory against Djerv 1919 (1st round),{{cite web|url=http://www.altomfotball.no/element.do?cmd=match&matchId=107582&tournamentId=110&seasonId=329 |title=Djerv 1919 - Haugesund |work=altomfotball |publisher=TV 2 |date=20 May 2007 |accessdate=7 October 2012}} and coming on in the 33rd minute in a 4–0 victory over [[Løv-Ham Fotball|Løv-Ham]] scoring one goal (third round).{{cite web|url=http://www.nifs.no/kampfakta.php?kamp_id=257026&land=1&t=14&u=2336 |title=Match Statistics – Norwegian & International Statistics of Football |publisher=Nifs.no |date=27 June 2007 |accessdate=15 March 2009}} Haugesund went all the way to [[2007 Norwegian Football Cup Final|the final]]. ===Arsenal=== [[Arsène Wenger]] travelled to Norway on 11 June 2007 to watch an Adeccoligaen match and begin negotiations to sign Nordtveit.{{cite web|url=http://fotballmagasinet.no/?mode=news&id=8169 |title=Arsene Wenger overvåket Håvard Nordtveit, og Haugesunds hjemmeseier |publisher=FotballMagasinet.no |first=Sten Christian |last=Kvindesland |accessdate=15 March 2009 |language=Norwegian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204100534/http://fotballmagasinet.no/?mode=news&id=8169 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} The members of the FKH board stated that the club had rejected Arsenal's initial bid. The player himself said that his club was asking for a "supernaturally high" transfer fee. The price being quoted in the Norwegian media was 20 million [[Norwegian krone]]r {{cite web|author=Øystein Eide |url=http://www.h-avis.no/article/20070611/SPORT/106110022/1062 |title=Er ikke 20 millioner nok? |publisher=Haugesunds Avis |date=30 April 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204171715/http://www.h-avis.no/article/20070611/SPORT/106110022/1062 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} (approximately £1.7 million at the time). A transfer fee was later finalized on 3 July 2007 for £500,000 initially, rising to £2m after 40 first team appearances. He was thereafter given the shirt number 55 by the club. Haugesund captain [[Kevin Nicol]] and former Norway coach [[Nils Johan Semb]] went on to praise him as the brightest defensive talent in Europe.{{cite web|url=http://youngguns.wordpress.com/2008/02/19/havard-nordtveit-brightest-defensive-talent-in-europe/ |title=Håvard Nordtveit, Brightest Defensive Talent In Europe? |publisher=Youngguns.wordpress.com |date=19 February 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304123309/http://youngguns.wordpress.com/2008/02/19/havard-nordtveit-brightest-defensive-talent-in-europe/ |archivedate=4 March 2009 }} He made his Arsenal debut in their first pre-season friendly against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] on 14 July 2007. Nordtveit came on after half-time, replacing [[Kerrea Gilbert]].{{cite web|url=https://www.arsenal.com/match/report/0708pre-season-barnet-0-2-arsenal-match-report|title=Barnet 0-2 Arsenal|website=Arsenal.com}} He was named captain of Arsenal's [[Arsenal F.C. Reserves|reserve squad]] for the first match of the [[2007–08 Premier Reserve League|2007–08]] [[FA Premier Reserve League]] season. In an interview with Arsenal.com, Nordtveit said he was "honoured" to have been named captain, and that he hoped to continue in that role in the future.{{cite web|url=https://www.bleacherreport.com/amp/2248347-former-arsenal-young-gun-havard-nordtveits-second-chance-at-gladbach.amp.html|title=Former Arsenal Young Gun Havard Nordtveit's 2nd Chance at Gladbach|website=Bleacher Report.com}} In the final game of the [[2007–08 in English football|2007–08]] season he was named on the substitutes' bench in Arsenal's 1-0 win over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/7381801.stm|title=Sunderland 0-1 Arsenal|website=BBC.co.uk|date=2008-05-11}} ====2008–09 season==== On 18 August 2008, [[UD Salamanca|Salamanca]] of the [[Segunda División]] signed him on a six-month loan.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/8/main/2008/08/19/825027/arsenal-defender-loaned-to-salamanca|title=Arsenal Defender Loaned To Salamanca|website=Goal.com}} At Salamanca he played alongside another young [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] player, [[Pedro Roberto Silva Botelho|Pedro Botelho]]. He came off the bench to make his debut for UD Salamanca as they drew 1-1 with [[Sevilla Atlético]] in the second fixture of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com.ng/match?gameId=254121|title=UD Salamanca 1-1 Sevilla Atlético|website=ESPN FC.com}} Arsenal recalled him on 29 October, after becoming unhappy with the amount of playing time the Norwegian had received.{{cite web|url=http://www.nettavisen.no/innenriks/ibergen/article2348443.ece |title=Blir i Arsenal til jul |publisher=Nettavisen.no |date= 30 October 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 | language = Norwegian | first = Ørjan | last = Nilsson}} However, he was not eligible to play for the club until 1 January 2009. On 21 January, he finally made his first appearance for the reserves since spending time on-loan at UD Salamanca, in a 2–2 draw against the [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] reserves. On 10 March 2009, [[Norwegian Premier League]] outfit [[Lillestrøm SK|Lillestrøm]] signed Nordtveit on loan until 1 August 2009.{{cite news|first=Tom |last=Adams |title=Another Young Gun goes on loan |url=http://www.setanta.com/uk/Articles/Football/2009/03/10/Premier-League-Nordtveit-joins-Lillestrom/gnid-43850/ |publisher=Setanta Sports |date=10 March 2009 |accessdate=10 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090314041330/http://www.setanta.com/uk/Articles/Football/2009/03/10/Premier-League-Nordtveit-joins-Lillestrom/gnid-43850/ |archivedate=14 March 2009 }} He made his debut in the [[Eliteserien (football)|Norwegian Premier League]] in Lillestrøm's season opener away against [[Stabæk Fotball|Stabæk]] as a right fullback.{{cite web|url=https://www.nrk.no/sport/fotball/stabaek---lillestrom-spark-for-spark-1.6525047|title=Poengdeling i serieåpningen|language=Norwegian|website=NRK.no|date=2009-03-14}} This was a role which he retained during his time with the Norwegian side. ====2009–10 season==== On 28 July 2009, [[1. FC Nürnberg]] agreed a one-year loan deal for the Norwegian defender from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite web | url = http://sport.msn.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/512037/artikel_Havard-Nordtveit-kommt-zum-Club.html | title = Havard Nordtveit kommt zum Club | language = German | publisher = sport.msn.de | date = 28 July 2009 | accessdate = 3 October 2012}} Despite being a centre-back, his primary role at [[1. FC Nürnberg|Nürnberg]] was in the defensive midfield position.{{cite web | url = http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/nordtveit-i-can-follow-in-bould-s-footsteps | title = Nordtveit – I can follow in Bould's footsteps | publisher = arsenal.com | date = 3 August 2010 | accessdate = 3 October 2012 | first = Chris | last = Harris}} ===Borussia Mönchengladbach=== On 30 December 2010, Nordtveit joined [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] on a three-and-a-half-year contract, the transfer fee was £800,000.{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-why-i-will-let-nordtveit-leave|title=Wenger — Why I will let Nordtveit|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=31 December 2010|first=Chris|last=Harris|accessdate=19 May 2016}} He made his competitive debut for the club on 15 January 2011 in their [[Bundesliga]] match against Nürnberg.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/nurnberg-vs-mgladbach/220857|title=Match Report|website=Sky Sports.com}} Nordtveit scored his first goal in Germany, against [[1. FC Köln]] in a 5–1 victory for Borussia Mönchengladbach.{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2010-11/29/1013496/spielanalyse_borussia-mgladbach-15_1-fc-koeln-16.html|title=Gladbach 5-1 Koln|language=German|website=Kicker.de}} He was used mostly as a defensive midfielder, and established himself as a key player for Gladbach, taking the departed [[Michael Bradley (soccer)|Michael Bradley]]'s place in the squad.{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/havard-nordtveit-west-ham-bound-ball-winner-who-arsenal-could-regret-letting-go|title=Havard Nordtveit: The West Ham-bound ball winner who Arsenal could regret letting go|website=Four Four Two.com|date=2016-05-16}} ===West Ham United=== On 16 May 2016, it was announced that Nordtveit would be joining [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 1 July 2016 on a five-year contract.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/west-ham-united-havard-nordveit-borussia-monchengladbach-free-transfer|title=West Ham sign Havard Nordtveit from Borussia Mönchengladbach|newspaper=The Guardian|date=2016-05-16|last1=Association|first1=Press}} He made his official debut for the ''Hammers'' on 28 July in a 2–1 defeat to [[NK Domžale]] in the first leg of a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] qualifying match, playing the full 90 minutes.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/nk-domzale-vs-west-ham/362689|title=Hammers lose in Slovenia|website=Sky Sports.com}} ===Hoffenheim=== On 20 June 2017, West Ham announced that Nordtveit had signed for German side [[TSG Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]], for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/june/20-june/havard-nordtveit-signs-hoffenheim|title=Havard Nordtveit signs for Hoffenheim|date=20 June 2017|accessdate=20 June 2017|publisher=West Ham United}} ==International career== Nordtveit was a regular for the Norway U-17 in qualifying and they barely missed out on a place at the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship|2007 European Championships]]. After that he was promoted to the U-19 squad and was ever-present during the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship qualification|2009 European Championship qualifying]], scoring twice, but once again Norway did not make it past the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship elite qualification|elite qualification stage]]. He has been a regular for the [[Norway national under-21 football team|U-21]] team in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification Group 7|2011 European Championship]] qualifying campaign.{{cite news|title=U21-TROPP TIL EM-KVALIK I SERBIA |publisher=[[Football Association of Norway|fotball.no]] |url=http://www.fotball.no/Landslag_og_toppfotball/Landslag/Aldersbestemt_gutter/U20/2009/U21-tropp-til-EM-kvalik-i-Serbia/ |date=2 November 2009 |language=Norwegian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120802114729/http://www.fotball.no/Landslag_og_toppfotball/Landslag/Aldersbestemt_gutter/U20/2009/U21-tropp-til-EM-kvalik-i-Serbia/ |archivedate=2 August 2012 |df=dmy-all }} He made his first international appearance on 7 June 2011, in a friendly game against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]]. Nordtveit scored his first goal for the national team when he scored Norway's first goal in the friendly match against [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]] on 29 February 2012, which Norway won 3–0.{{cite web |url=http://www.tv2.no/sport/fotball/landslag/sterk-sluttspurt-sikret-norgeseier-3721276.html |language=Norwegian |title=Sterk sluttspurt sikret Norge-seier |work=tv2.no |publisher=[[TV 2 (Norway)|TV 2]] |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=29 February 2012}} Nordtveit later became a regular in the senior squad, but in October 2012 he was suspended from playing the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]] due to yellow cards.{{cite news |url=http://www.vg.no/sport/fotball/norsk/landslaget/artikkel.php?artid=10062288 |language=Norwegian |title=Nordtveit klar for U21-landskamp mot Frankrike |publisher=Verdens Gang |first=Øyvind |last=Askeland |first2=Sindre |last2=Øgar |date=15 October 2012 |accessdate=16 November 2012}} Nordtveit was instead called up for the under-21 side where he played an important role in the 5–3 win against [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] when Norway qualified for the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]].{{cite news |url=http://www.vg.no/sport/fotball/norsk/landslaget/artikkel.php?artid=10062475 |language=Norwegian |title=Nordtveit trodde EM røk da Frankrike reduserte |publisher=Verdens Gang |first=Øyvind |last=Askeland |date=17 October 2012 |accessdate=16 November 2012}} ===International goals=== :''Scores and results list Norway's goal tally first.'' {| class="wikitable" ! # !!
